Backend

Class UserDataBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • Backend.UserDataBase

  • public class UserDataBase
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is easily extensible to allow temporary users as this class will simply not write/read to a file but instead just keep the temporary user in the linked list.

    • Method Detail

      • doesUserExist

        public static boolean doesUserExist(java.lang.String username)

      • retrieveUser

        public static User retrieveUser(java.lang.String username)
        This method will return a User object corresponding to the user input in the method. If the user does not exist in the database, null is returned.

        Parameters:
        username - A string of the unique username
        Returns:
        A user object if the user is found, otherwise null is returned

      • retrieveUser

        public static User retrieveUser(User user)
        This method will return a User object corresponding to the user input in the method. If that user does not exist in the database, null is returned

        Parameters:
        user - A user object
        Returns:
        Null if the user does not exist in the database, otherwise the User object in the database.

      • addUser

        public static void addUser(User user)
        Adds a User object to the database and updates the file on the hard drive. Only does so if the username does not already exist in the database

        Parameters:
        user - The user to be added

      • isValidPassword

        public static boolean isValidPassword(java.lang.String password)
        Checks if the password is valid or not based on the specifications. A valid password is an alphanumeric only password of at least 6 characters in length
        Parameters:
        password - The password to check
        Returns:
        True if the password is valid, else false;

      • modifyUser

        public static void modifyUser(User user)
        This method takes in a User object and sets the entry in the database to that user object passed in. This will prove useful when updating user information. This method assumes the username is not changed. Therefore usernames cannot change.
        Parameters:
        user - A user object to be modified to

      • getAllUsers

        public static java.util.LinkedList<User> getAllUsers()
